NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship: Break into product management with our 16 week Product Management Course
The NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship is the perfect launchpad for aspiring product managers looking to break into the industry. Our structured product management course offers a hands-on learning experience, equipping you with the skills, tools and insights required to become a successful product manager in today's competitive landscape.
Who is it for
The NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship is designed for early career working professionals looking to transition into product management roles like Product Analyst, Associate Product Manager, Product Manager in top technology companies. Our average cohort has
2-3 years of work experience
90% of the cohort is made up of working professionals and the remaining with college students.
While no prior product knowledge is required, we expect students to put in 14-15 hours of effort every week to master the relevant skills required for the role.
Why Choose NextLeap
Here is why 7000+ students have chosen NextLeap to kickstart their career into product management:
Benefit
Other Courses
NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship
Structured Curriculum
Mostly theoretical and interview focused.
Lack depth in fundamental product discovery concepts.
Systems thinking, mapping outcomes, and user segmentation not covered.
No in-depth coverage of SQL.
Teach only concepts, not hands-on execution.
Do not teach how to build AI products.
Holistic curriculum covering new-age product management topics including AI.
Strong focus on practical and hands-on learning.
Case-based learning for systems thinking, outcome mapping, user segmentation, user research, and problem framing.
Dedicated build hours focused on applying AI tools to real products.
3 weeks of in-depth SQL classes.
Exhaustive interview preparation through 10+ live classes.
Live Class Depth
Mostly recorded sessions.
At best ~50 hours of live classes over 4 months.
Completely live, online class-based learning.
100+ hours of live classes.
Spanning 16 weeks.
Case based practical learning experience
Only cites publicly available cases.
Learning remains largely theoretical.
Concepts explained through carefully curated real-world cases from instructors’ lived experiences.
Weekly case-hour sessions for hands-on practice and structured thinking.
Personalised Mentorship
Limited availability of personalised support.
Personalised feedback on assignments for every student.
Weekly mentor sessions for individual career-related queries.
AI Advantage
Limited to using a few AI tools.
No focus on building or deploying production-grade AI products.
20+ hours of live classes on LLMs, prompt engineering, RAGs, fine-tuning, agentic AI, and AI evaluations.
15+ hours of guided build sessions to build and deploy AI products.
Monthly hands-on community workshops on AI tools.
Monthly AI hackathons.
On-demand interview practice with NextLeap AI Interviewer.
Daily practice challenges with AI learning co-pilot.
SQL practice on the SQL Playground with AI co-pilot.
Resume-building guidance using the AI resume builder.
Placement Support
Limited to access to job boards.
3 weeks of live interview preparation classes.
Unlimited on-demand practice with AI Interviewer.
Mock interviews with mentors.
Portfolio and resume preparation guidance.
1 year of placement support for Top Fellows.
20+ exclusive hiring partner opportunities every month.
Average CTC of 12–14 LPA for Top Fellows.
Affordability
Costs 80,000 INR+.
Often requires taking a loan.
Costs less than 40,000 INR.
Easy payment through bank EMIs.
An industry relevant Curriculum
You will go through an intensive 16 week learning journey which will cover a comprehensive curriculum to help you master all the skills you need to build successful products in this new AI age.
Week 1: Mapping Business Outcomes to Product Outcomes
Systems Thinking : understanding actors, flows, bottlenecks
Systems Thinking Tools: behaviour over time graphs, causal diagrams, iceberg model
First principles thinking: actor, action, entity diagrams
Understanding different types of Business Models
Building KPI Trees for structured problem solving
Hands-on Learning:
Case on Swiggy Customer Support:
Building a KPI Tree to map business outcomes to product outcomes
Week 2: Product Discovery & User Research
Impact Mapping to map product outcomes to opportunities
User segmentation methodologies
Opportunity sizing
User Research Methodologies
Identifying unmet needs and Jobs to be Done framework
Journey Mapping & their relevance
Building User Personas
Affinity Mapping to derive insights from user research
How to use AI tools for user research
Hands-on Learning:
Case on an early stage food-tech startup:
Analysing a dataset to identify the target user segment and crafting a user research plan
Week 3: Problem Framing & Ideation
Hypotheses building
Problem Framing canvas
Mindmapping solutions
Understanding Benefits and constraints for each actor
Understanding product risks
Crafting User Stories
Understanding Human Motivations to build solutions
Prioritising between solutions
Understanding how to build user flows and wireframes
Hands-on Learning:
Case on building a new feature for Spotify:
Build an AI assisted prototype using vibe coding tools
Week 4: UX Design & AI Prototyping
Learn about UX Laws
How to think about Information architecture in UX Design
How to design prototypes on Figma
Learn AI assisted prototyping with vibe coding tools
Spec driven development with vibe coding tools
Data model driven development with vibe coding tools
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Learn how to write a data query with SQL
Week 5: Product Growth & Metrics
Different stages of the growth cycle
Minimum viable product (MVP) and Minimum Viable Test (MVT)
4 Fits of Product Market Fit
Loops, Funnels and Networks
Product Led Growth Strategies
Understanding Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Engagement, Revenue, Referral
Go to market (GTM) strategies in the AI age
How to define metrics
Customer Metrics and Business Metrics
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and North Star Metrics
Building a Metrics Tree
Guardrail Metrics or Key Failure Indicators (KFIs)
Data Analysis techniques: funnel and cohort analysis
Data tracking and instrumentation: events, variables and more
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Writing complex queries using JOINS
Week 6: Tech 101 & System Design
How the Internet works
Client-Server models
Different types of databases
APIs and their types: REST, SOAP, GraphQL
Synchronous and asynchronous APIs
High Level System Diagrams
AI system architectures
Cost vs quality trade-offs in AI products
Understand Version control
Set up GitHub
Set up Cursor
Hands-on Learning:
SQL:
Writing complex queries using aggregate functions & window functions
AI Tools:
GitHub and Cursor setup
Week 7: LLMs & Prompt Engineering
Basics of Machine Learning
Supervised vs unsupervised learning
Understanding Large Language Models (LLMs) and how they work
Difference between top LLMs
Anatomy of a Prompt
Prompt Engineering techniques
Context engineering and prompt decay
System prompts, temperature settings and more
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Build a basic chatbot by integrating with LLM APIs and system prompts
Week 8: RAGs, Fine Tuning & AI Automations
Embeddings & vector databases
Chunking & retrieval techniques
Workflow triggers & JSON
Orchestrating LLM steps
Chaining architecture
Adding reasoning and memory
Building AI workflows
How to fine tune models to add context
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Build a RAG enabled chatbot for a mutual fund house
Week 9: AI Agents & Protocols
What are AI workflows
Difference between AI workflows and AI agents
Agent frameworks
Long term and short term memory
Agentic AI protocols: MCP vs A2A
Multi-agent systems
Agent performance
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Building an AI workflow automation to analyse competitor ads data
Week 10:
AI Output Evaluation
Failure modes & bias
Eval rubrics & metrics
Golden sets & A/B tests
LLM-as-judge limits
Hands-on Learning:
AI Tools:
Building an AI agent for a mutual fund house.
Week 11:
Interview Prep: Guesstimates & RCAs
Types of Interviews
How to classify interview questions
Learn how to ask Clarifying questions during interviews
Understand how to approach Guesstimates questions
Master strategies to answer Root Cause Analysis (RCAs) questions
Interview Rubric for Guesstimates & RCAs
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors
Week 12:
Interview Prep: Product Design & Metrics
Learn how to answer Product Design questions
Understand how to answer Metrics Interview questions
Master strategies to answer A/B Testing questions
Interview Rubric for Product Design Questions
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors
Week 13:
Interview Prep: Strategy & AI Product Sense
Learn how to answer Product strategy questions
Master how to answer Pricing & GTM questions
Understand what are AI Product sense questions and how to answer them
Interview Rubric for AI Product Sense questions
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors
Week 14-16:
Graduation Project
Continue to build portfolio
Work on graduation project
Submit graduation project
Hands-on Learning:
Mock Interviews with mentors
Master the Tools to become a successful Product Manager
The NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship is designed to help you master tools that product managers frequently work with, through hands-on practice. Here are the tools that you will learn to use:
Microsoft Clarity & Hotjar:
For User Research
Whimsical:
For Mindmaps & KPI Trees
Figma:
For Wireframing & Design
JIRA:
For product roadmapping and execution
Google Analytics:
For product analytics
Microsoft Excel & SQL:
For data analysis
Open AI & Claude :
For prompt engineering
N8n & Make:
For AI workflows
Lovable:
For building prototypes
Cursor:
To build working products with code
GitHub:
for version control
Learn from Instructors who are Industry experts
In the NextLeap Product Manager Fellowship, you learn from industry and domain experts who share their real world experience to help you master the required skills.
Arindam Mukherjee
teaches the curriculum in the first 3 weeks. He is the co-founder of NextLeap and was previously the head of consumer product and growth at Flipkart for almost 7 years. He holds a Harvard Business School MBA and is an alum of IIT Kharagpur, with close to 2 decades of experience in the technology industry.
Karthi Subbaraman
leads the design team at ServiceNow and has previously worked at Microsoft and Salesforce as part of the design leadership team. She teaches the user research module.
Prashanth Bhaskaran
is a product lead at Uber and was previously leading the data platform product at CRED. He teaches the Interview Prep module.
Eshan Tiwari
is a Lead Data Scientist at Meta and has previously worked at Google in data science roles. He teaches modules on AI.
Kartik Singh
is a senior product designer at Microsoft and teaches the Wireframing & UX Foundations modules.
Devansh
is a Product Lead at Jiostar and was previously a Product Manager at Flipkart. He teaches the Metrics module and the case hour sessions.
Saksham Arora
is a senior software engineer at Intuit and was previously a software engineer at Microsoft. He teaches the technology foundations module and how to build products with AI tools like Cursor.
Shailesh Sharma
is a Senior Product Manager at Myntra and teaches the Interview Prep modules
Along with an amazing set of instructors, students are guided along their learning journey by experienced mentors who are senior product managers across companies like Jiostar, Flipkart, Microsoft, Betterplace, Google, Bhanzu, Zepto, Lenskart and more.
Work on real world projects: Apply what you learn
The 16-week Product Manager Fellowship is a hands-on learning experience where you will work on real world projects and build a strong product portfolio to stand out from the competition.
Fortnightly assignments:
Step into the shoes of a product manager to solve a real-world problem by going through the product lifecycle. During the Fellowship, you will work on a set of 3 assignments – start with a breakdown of the problem, go deeper with user research, frame the problem, ideate possible solutions, craft wireframes, define metrics and write up a product requirements document (PRD)
Learn in Public Challenges:
Go the extra mile by working on projects focused on building production ready products with AI tools, analysing datasets with SQL and product teardowns of popular product features.
100+ Problem sets on SQL:
Practice your SQL skills on our SQL playground by attempting the 100+ problem sets.
AI Hackathons:
Participate in monthly community hackathons to build prototypes, workflows and agents using AI tools.
Graduation Project:
Put your skills to test with the graduation project by working on a real-world project that will be evaluated by our mentors.
Here are sample portfolios of our alums.
Timings and Class Schedule
The Fellowship is designed for working professionals with the live online classes happening at the following times:
2 Live Classes on Saturday
(10:30 AM IST - 12:30 PM IST and 2 PM IST - 4 PM IST)
Mentor Session on Sunday
(10:30 AM IST - 12:30 PM IST)
Case Hour/Build Hour Session on Sunday
(2 PM IST - 4 PM IST)
Community Event/Workshop on Thursday
(9 PM IST - 10:30 PM IST)
Daily Practice Challenges from Monday - Friday
(self-paced)
Success Stories & Testimonials
NextLeap has helped 1500+ learners transition into successful product management careers. Hear from some of our graduates:
"This 12 week journey has been nothing short of extraordinary. From diving deep into product strategy to honing my problem-solving skills and mastering the art of effective communication, every moment has been a stepping stone towards personal and professional growth." — Vanshika Rajput (transitioned from a Fresher to an Associate Product Manager at Secure Layer 7)
"The fellowship was rigorous yet a very rewarding experience. It made learning an exciting process which I looked forward to every week and I learned so much about the fundamentals of product management. I had the opportunity to learn from industry experts and work on real-world case studies." — Gaurang Beli (transitioned from a Business Analyst to Associate Product Manager at Lendbox)
“Enrolling in Nextleap’s Product Manager Fellowship has truly been one of the best decisions I’ve made in my career journey. The guidance and teachings have been invaluable throughout the program, and I am deeply grateful for the placement support you provided in helping me land product roles. The team’s dedication and genuine commitment to student success make Nextleap the most authentic and trustworthy edtech company I have encountered.” – Geetika Aggarwal (transitioned from a microbiologist to an Associate Product Manager role at F22 Labs)
“Overall, I had a great experience with NextLeap. They offer a structured learning format where you don’t have to gather resources yourself, everything you need is conveniently available in one place. They focus on teaching the most relevant and in-demand topics in product management, so you don’t get overwhelmed by unnecessary details. I really appreciated this streamlined approach. The mentors are also excellent, providing valuable guidance throughout. Additionally, the job assistance provided by NextLeap is solid, if you complete the program successfully, they offer strong placement support. This is undoubtedly the best product management course in the market” – Satyanarayan Panda (landed a Product Manager role at Healthletic Lifestyle)
“I had a really fulfilling experience with NextLeap. What stood out to me was how well-structured the entire program was. Unlike many other courses where you have to figure things out yourself, NextLeap provides everything you need in one place—well-organized resources, live sessions, and hands-on projects that make learning easier and more practical. The curriculum is thoughtfully designed to cover only the most relevant and in-demand product management skills. The mentors were another highlight of the program. They brought real-world experience to the table and were always approachable for guidance or feedback. Their insights made a huge difference in how I approached problems and thought about product thinking. Lastly, the job assistance is genuinely strong. If you’re serious about the program and complete it properly, the placement support team does a great job connecting you with real opportunities. Overall, I’d highly recommend NextLeap to anyone who wants a clear, guided path into product management with strong mentorship and career support.” – Danwantari Sri Satya Sai (landed a Product Analyst role at Darwinbox)
“As someone from a non-tech background, I was initially unsure about how to break into product management. But NextLeap made the journey structured, practical, and inspiring. The program stands out for its industry-relevant curriculum, hands-on projects like product teardowns, PRDs, and mock interviews, and mentorship from experienced product leaders. The community is one of the most active and supportive I've seen — you’re constantly learning from peers, mentors, and alumni. One of the biggest value-adds for me was the “Learn in Public” challenge, which helped me improve my written communication and build a portfolio. I also gained clarity on how to structure my thought process, use tools like Jira, Figma, SQL, and communicate user-first solutions confidently. If you're serious about becoming a product manager and want a guided, immersive experience, I highly recommend NextLeap – it is one of the best product management courses out there.” – Sarthak Kakar (landed a product internship role at Bookchor.com)

NextLeap is a fast-growing startup in the workforce skilling segment, revolutionizing career transitions for early career professionals in India. Founded with the mission to bridge the gap between traditional education and real-world skills, NextLeap offers bootcamp-style Fellowship programs designed to help individuals break into new age technology roles in
Product Management, UX Design/Product Design, Data Analytics, Business Analytics and Software Engineering.
Since its inception in 2021, NextLeap has empowered over
15,000+ learners
to successfully transition into technology careers, thanks to a curriculum rooted in hands-on learning, personalised mentorship from industry leaders, extensive interview practice and a strong focus on job placement.
What sets NextLeap apart is its focus on outcomes led learning delivered at an affordable cost via an AI enabled full stack technology platform. NextLeap has been voted as one of the Top 100 Edtech startups in South Asia by HolonIQ and has since established itself as a trusted learning platform driven for career advancement in India’s tech landscape.
© 2023-2024, Elemento Learning Technologies Pvt. Ltd.
